snippet: The Internet retailer took in almost $1 billion less than analysts expected in the fourth quarter, sending its shares down sharply after hours.
abstract: Amazon.com misses sales forecasts in fourth-quarter reporting, an important distinction for the online retailer that has been telling Wall Street for years to ignore how little money it was making and focus on the fact that it was bringing in more customers; net income decreased 58 percent to $177 million in the fourth quarter, or 38 cents a share, compared with $416 million, or 91 cents a share, in the year-earlier period.
lead_paragraph: The Internet retailer took in almost $1 billion less than analysts expected in the fourth quarter, sending its shares down sharply after hours.

headline.seo: Amazon Shares Drop as Revenues Fall Short
